metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35653 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Pillow before 8.1.0, PcxDecode has a buffer over-read when decoding a crafted PCX file because the user-supplied stride value is trusted for buffer calculations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-imaging-compat - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-imaging - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-imaging-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-imaging-tk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-pil - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
python3-sane - 2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1ubuntu3.4+esm2').
